intro: Taraxacum calcareum, commonly known as the limestone dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flower heads and toothed, basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This plant thrives in calcareous soils, preferring well-drained, alkaline environments. It is typically found in open areas such as grasslands, roadsides, and disturbed soils. The plant is perennial, with a rosette of leaves that support a single flower stalk that rises above the foliage.
